business_definition: Percentage of users who complete KYC verification within 7 days of starting registration
sql_definition: COUNT(DISTINCT CASE WHEN kyc_approved AND days_to_kyc <= 7 THEN user_id END) / COUNT(DISTINCT CASE WHEN registration_start THEN user_id END)
numerator: Users with kyc_approved event within 7 days of registration_start
caveats_edge_cases: Excludes users who haven't reached 7-day window yet. KYC resubmissions count as single attempt.

business_definition: Percentage of users who complete their first transaction within 14 days of account creation
sql_definition: COUNT(DISTINCT CASE WHEN first_transaction AND days_since_account <= 14 THEN user_id END) / COUNT(DISTINCT CASE WHEN account_created THEN user_id END)
numerator: Users with first_transaction within 14 days of account_created
caveats_edge_cases: Users still in 14-day window excluded from denominator. Failed transactions do not count.

business_definition: Percentage of activated users who remain active in their first week
sql_definition: COUNT(DISTINCT CASE WHEN week1_active THEN user_id END) / COUNT(DISTINCT CASE WHEN first_transaction THEN user_id END)
caveats_edge_cases: Week1_active defined as 2+ transactions or 3+ logins within 7 days. Time window may not have elapsed for recent cohorts.

business_definition: Median time from KYC submission to decision (approved or rejected)
numerator: Time difference in hours between decision_time and submitted_time
caveats_edge_cases: Business hours vs. calendar hours distinction. Resubmissions reset the clock. Weekends may inflate median.

business_definition: Percentage of KYC cases that are rejected on first submission
sql_definition: COUNT(CASE WHEN decision = 'rejected' THEN 1 END) / COUNT(*)
caveats_edge_cases: Resubmissions after rejection not included in denominator. Automated vs manual review distinction not captured.

business_definition: Number of support tickets created per 1,000 users
caveats_edge_cases: Some users create multiple tickets. Rate does not account for ticket severity. New users may not have had time to encounter issues.

business_definition: Median time from account creation to first completed transaction
numerator: Time difference in hours between first_transaction and account_created
caveats_edge_cases: Only includes users who eventually transact. Users who never transact are excluded, biasing metric downward.

business_definition: Percentage of first_funding attempts that succeed
sql_definition: COUNT(CASE WHEN first_funding AND funding_status = 'success' THEN 1 END) / COUNT(CASE WHEN first_funding_attempted THEN 1 END)
caveats_edge_cases: Requires instrumentation of funding_status. Failed attempts followed by retry may double-count. External bank downtime can temporarily depress rate.

business_definition: Percentage of transaction attempts that complete successfully
sql_definition: COUNT(CASE WHEN status = 'success' THEN 1 END) / COUNT(*)
caveats_edge_cases: Pending transactions excluded from numerator but included in denominator. User-initiated cancellations vs system failures not distinguished.

business_definition: Percentage of users who start registration but do not submit verification documents
sql_definition: (COUNT(DISTINCT CASE WHEN registration_start THEN user_id END) - COUNT(DISTINCT CASE WHEN verification_submitted THEN user_id END)) / COUNT(DISTINCT CASE WHEN registration_start THEN user_id END)
numerator: Users with registration_start but no verification_submitted
time_window: 30 days from registration_start (allow time to complete)
caveats_edge_cases: Users may still be in-flow. Long time windows reduce accuracy. High rates suggest UX friction or unclear requirements.

business_definition: Percentage of KYC-approved users who proceed to create an account
sql_definition: COUNT(DISTINCT CASE WHEN account_created THEN user_id END) / COUNT(DISTINCT CASE WHEN kyc_approved THEN user_id END)
caveats_edge_cases: Theoretically should be 100% (automated flow), but technical failures or user abandonment can cause drop-off. Investigate if <95%.

business_definition: Ratio of activation rates between paid_social and referral channels
caveats_edge_cases: Not a standalone KPI. Used to benchmark channel quality. Referral typically outperforms paid due to trust signal. Target ratio: 0.6-0.8.

business_definition: Average monetary value of completed transactions
sql_definition: SUM(amount WHERE status = 'success') / COUNT(*) WHERE status = 'success')
caveats_edge_cases: Outlier transactions (very large or very small) can skew. Consider median as alternative. Currency conversion required for multi-currency.
